name: Bounce's Adventure Milestone #2 Audiovisual Prototype!
description:
Bounce's Adventure!

Bounce's Adventure is a 2D  puzzle game. Players assume the role of Bounce, a spherical being who must save his friends from the impending doom of the Polygonites, evil beings who will stop at nothing to turn the world into a sharp, angled abomination. Bounce must rescue his fellow Spherians by launching himself through treacherous environments, avoiding hazards and traps set by the Polygonites. Only united with his brethren, may Bounce have a chance at returning the world to circular form. 

**HOW TO PLAY**

1. Click and drag the mouse to launch Bounce around the level

2. Use Bounce to collect his friends in the level.

3. Avoid Polygonite enemies! Some can hurt you!

4. After collecting all of your Spherian friends, make your way to the goal flag!! 

**Short Responses**

  1. How did you arrive with this particular visual (and audio) style for the game? Add reference photos in your response.
    1. I arrived at this audio and visual style because I wanted to create a game with an srt style and color palette similar to Lovely Planet and Pongo. The visuals came from geometric Photoshop works I created, and I found sounds I felt fit into the game from freesound.org
  2. What does this style contribute to the gameplay? Include before / after screenshots in your response (your game before audiovisual phase + your game after audiovisual phase).
    1. This style helped denote certain game objects from one another. For example, it was hard to decipher which enemies hurt, and which enemies didn't. Through my game art, I have helped the player to better understand what is safe and unsafe when playing my game
  3. What was the most challenging aspect of the audiovisual phase for you?
    1. The most challenging aspect of this audiovisual phase was sound. I had a lot of difficulty when it came to working with sound code. Searching for and discovering sounds that fit with my game was another challenge as well.
